content.description: We belayed at the base of a gully scrambling to the beginning of a crack 30 feet up. The action starts immediately with friendly right foot, small ledge halfway. We continued up to the end of the crack instead of traversing left, unlike description in Gillett's, so we added a variation to the route name.
content.protection: A small standard rack plus #3, #3.5, #4, & #4.5 Camalots.
content.location: It is on the obvious cliff downstream from a shack. On the east face, find a hand crack halfway up the gully with orange lichen at the start.

content.description:
P1. Climb the east face through broken rock and ledges, pass an overhang on the right side and through a slot, and set belay at top of the spire.

P2. Downclimb to gain the wall behind the top of the spire. Traverse left following a crack until below vertical crack which leads to the top. Set good pro at bottom & middle of crack, and shoot for the top through a runout upper section. With a cleaning tool, you may be able to get more pro in this crack.
content.location: On west face of Violator Buttress to east of a shack, find a nice looking, short crack on a slab just below the summit.

content.description:
This is from a TR ascent.

Climb a crack past the first overhang. A huge guano mound is easy bypassed to reach the second overhang which widens for 4.5 and the crux. Clip a bolt on the right undercling bulge. Walking your feet up as high as possible, shoot for a jug high on the left.

Save a yellow/red Camalot for a horizontal, then face climb (5.9) slab clipping another (1/4") bolt.
content.protection: A standard rack, a #4.5 Camalot at the crux on the upper overhang, and a red/yellow Camalot at an upper horizontal. There are 2 bolts (1/4 inch). You will need a 70m rope to rap, or do a scary downclimb off the back side.
content.location: It is in the center of the cliff on the South face and goes up a crack through two overhangs, ending on a slab near the top.

content.description: Climb a crack to the second tree with a sling, which can be used for descent.
content.location: Find a crack on wall climber's left behind a shack, next to broken roof in shape of an M.

pathTokens: Middle Fork of St. Vrain Canyon
